Uses of Class
com.sun.pisces.LineSink

Uses of LineSink in com.sun.pisces
 

Subclasses of LineSink in com.sun.pisces
 class Dasher
          The Dasher class takes a series of linear commands (moveTo, lineTo, close and end) and breaks them into smaller segments according to a dash pattern array and a starting dash phase.
 class Flattener
          The Flattener class rewrites a general path, which may include curved segments, into one containing only linear segments suitable for sending to a LineSink.
 class PathSink
          The LineSink interface extends the PathSink interface, and additionally accepts curve drawing commands: quadTo and curveTo.
 class PathStore
           
 class PiscesRenderer
           
 class RendererBase
           
 class Stroker
           
 class Transformer
           
 

Methods in com.sun.pisces with parameters of type LineSink
 void Stroker.setOutput(LineSink output)
          Sets the output LineSink of this Stroker.
 void Flattener.setOutput(LineSink output)
          Sets the output LineSink of this Flattener.
 void Dasher.setOutput(LineSink output)
          Sets the output LineSink of this Dasher.
 

Constructors in com.sun.pisces with parameters of type LineSink
Dasher(LineSink output, int[] dash, int phase, Transform4 transform)
          Constructs a Dasher.
Flattener(LineSink output, int flatness)
          Constructs a Flattener that will rewrite any incoming quadTo and curveTo commands into a series of lineTo commands with maximum X and Y extents no larger than the supplied flatness value.
Stroker(LineSink output, int lineWidth, int capStyle, int joinStyle, int miterLimit, Transform4 transform)
          Constructs a Stroker.
